text:
The prismatic glow from the city’s crystalline towers swelled in the aftermath, refracting through the air above the platform where Seris and Veyr stood. Their auras, raw and exposed, blazed in resonance—no longer gilded by magical relics, but forged by the cost of their giving. Spotlights of ambient mana, lured by the flare of sacrifice, painted the suspended walkway beneath their feet in shifting auroras.

Seris’s hands trembled against the cold curve of the mana chain, her bare scalp tingling where the Aurora Tresses had once pulsed with living light. Veyr’s fingers—freed from the subtle tick of the ancestral lightwatch—clutched the Crystal Combs, vibrant yet now dulled without the symphonic harmony of her now-absent hair. He reached for her. The hush of onlookers murmured beneath the spires; above, the all-seeing ‘eye’ of The Grand Lumen blinked, a silent witness to their folly—or perhaps their triumph.

Through her auditory implant, Seris heard Veyr’s breath falter, caught on grief; felt his uncertainty, heavy in the air. Yet the bond between them was suddenly weightless, as if the sacrifices had burned away every gilded pretense. She stepped forward. “I thought... if you had your lightwatch, this chain would renew its magic.”

“And I thought my gift would let you shape the city’s light again.” Veyr’s voice, cracked but sure, wrapped around her. “But I’ve given up the watch. For you.”

She managed a shaky laugh, then reached to press the chain into his palm, fingers entwining with his. Their auras shimmered where their skin touched: warm, vulnerable, radiant. “We have lost what made us shine, but—look.”

In the crystalline reflection of a passing watcher, they saw themselves bathed in aura no relic could conjure—greater than any mana glyph, wilder than any augmentation. The city, still and rapt, held its breath, and above, the Grand Lumen’s ‘eye’ widened in a rare bloom of approving light.

Veyr drew Seris close, uncaring that the Crystal Combs fell from his hand and scattered on the walkway, catching only fractured gleams. His lips brushed her brow, where memory of the Tresses lingered. “Perhaps what we carry inside burns brighter without artifice.”

Seris nodded, tears caught in light. Hand in hand, they crossed the veined bridge toward home, their mingled aura illuminating the path. Behind them, whispers started—awe, envy, hope—echoing from spire to spire as the Citadel of Nodes pulsed in time to their love.

Above it all, the old man’s ‘eye’ watched, its aperture softly humming, as if—just for a moment—it understood what it saw. Seris and Veyr walked on, their loss—transformed—guiding their way into the luminous unknown.
summary: Seris and Veyr, standing in the aftermath of their mutual sacrifice, embrace their loss and rediscover the true essence of their love. Their auras flare brilliantly in the wake of giving, impressing the city and the all-seeing Grand Lumen. Without their relics, they walk forward together, recognized and guided by the radiant bond their sacrifices have forged.
